data.title: ‘Sarah Silverman: Postmortem’ tour will make a stop in Pa. Where to buy tickets
data.meta_description: Silverman is two-time Emmy Award-winning comedian, actress and writer.
data.text:
Two-time Emmy Award-winning comedian, Sarah Silverman, is going on a tour that includes a stop in Pa.

“Sarah Silverman: Postmortem” will be in Philadelphia on Thursday, Nov. 21, 2024, at The Met.

The tour includes a special live taping during her two shows at the Beacon Theatre in New York City on Jan. 17 and Jan. 18, 2025.

Fans can find tickets to her Philadelphia performance here:

Stubhub, prices start at $83

SeatGeek, prices start at $93

Vivid Seats, prices start at $83

“Her most recent special ‘Sarah Silverman: Someone You Love,’ was nominated for a Grammy, Golden Globe and Critics Choice Award and is streaming on Max. She also continues to host her critically acclaimed, weekly podcast, ‘The Sarah Silverman Podcast’, which relaunched on Oct. 19 through Lemonada on all platforms and TBS’ ‘Stupid Pet Tricks,’ an expansion of the famous David Letterman late night segment,” according to a Live Nation news release.

Silverman appeared in the Netflix biopic “Maestro” on the life of composer Leonard Bernstein. She portrayed Bernstein’s sister Shirley.

Tour dates also include:

Sept. 19 - St. Louis, Missouri
